We are going to try to address some frequently asked questions to get information out to families. The first question:

WHAT IS THE PLAN FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING ICTC?

The current plan is that students attending ICTC will attend ICTC every day. We will be running ICTC buses as usual. Students are permitted to ride the regular bus to and from school daily if they do not have other transportation. The ICTC bus will drop students back off at the school around 11:15. If the student does not have transportation home on their remote learning day, they will remain in the library to work on their remote learning for the afternoon. If an ICTC student is riding home with another student, we must have a permission slip from both parents. Students may not drive to ICTC due to parking, unless special permission is granted by both MC and ICTC.

Today, it was my privilege to welcome members and coaches of the Marion Center Junior/Senior High School Girls’ Cross Country Team to our state Capitol and to officially recognize this very special group of young women on the House floor for capturing the 2018 PIAA Class 1A state championship.

Children learn so much and grow so quickly in their first five years it can be hard to keep up! The Early Learning GPS can help. Answer up to 10 questions for great tips and reliable resources. Create a free map for your child to follow his milestones, save fun activities that will help them learn and grow, and compare child care programs. All information is from reliable sources like PA’s Office of Child Development and Early Learning. Get started at www.earlylearninggps.com. #PAPromise
